title: Paneer Bhurji
steps: Heat oil in a pan on medium heat.
Add chopped onions and sauté until light golden.
Add ginger garlic paste and cook until raw smell disappears.
Add green chili and chopped tomatoes.
Cook until tomatoes become soft and oil separates slightly.
Add turmeric, red chili, coriander powder, and salt.
Mix spices well and cook for 30 seconds.
Add crumbled paneer and mix gently.
Cook for 5 minutes while stirring occasionally.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with roti.
memoryNote: Quick paneer dish mom makes for lunch.

title: Vegetable Pulao
steps: Wash basmati rice thoroughly and soak for 20 minutes.
Heat ghee in a pot and add bay leaf, cloves, and cinnamon.
Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add mixed vegetables and cook for 2 minutes.
Drain rice and add to the pot, stirring gently.
Add salt and measured water.
Bring to a boil, then cover and cook on low heat for 15 minutes.
Turn off heat and let rest for 5 minutes.
Fluff rice gently and serve hot.

title: Besan Chilla
steps: Take besan in a bowl and add turmeric and salt.
Add water slowly and whisk to form a smooth batter.
Add chopped onion, tomato, and green chili to batter.
Mix everything well and let rest for 5 minutes.
Heat a non-stick pan and grease lightly with oil.
Pour a ladle of batter and spread in circular motion.
Drizzle oil around edges and cook on medium heat.
Flip and cook other side until golden.
Remove from pan and repeat for remaining batter.
Serve hot with green chutney.

title: Shahi Paneer
steps: Heat butter in a pan on low heat.
Add onion paste and cook until light golden.
Add tomato puree and cook until thick.
Add cashew paste and mix well.
Add chili powder, garam masala, and salt.
Add paneer cubes gently.
Simmer for 5 minutes on low flame.
Add fresh cream and stir lightly.
Cook 2 more minutes and turn off heat.
Serve hot with naan or roti.

title: Vegetable Cutlet
steps: Mash boiled potatoes and vegetables in a bowl.
Add salt, pepper, and green chili.
Mix everything to form a uniform dough.
Shape into flat round patties.
Roll each patty in breadcrumbs.
Heat oil in a pan on medium heat.
Place cutlets and shallow fry until golden.
Flip and cook the other side evenly.
Remove on paper towel to drain oil.
Serve hot with ketchup or chutney.

title: Palak Dal
steps: Wash dal and cook with turmeric until soft.
Heat oil and crackle cumin seeds.
Add onions and sauté until golden.
Add cooked dal and mix well.
Add chopped spinach and salt.
Simmer for 5 minutes until spinach cooks.
Turn off heat and let rest.
Stir gently before serving.
Serve hot with rice or roti.

title: Gajar Halwa
steps: Heat ghee in a pan and add grated carrot.
Cook carrots on medium heat for 5 minutes.
Add milk and simmer until milk reduces.
Stir frequently to prevent sticking.
Add sugar and cook until mixture thickens.
Add cardamom powder and mix well.
Add chopped nuts and stir.
Cook 2 more minutes and turn off heat.
Serve warm or chilled.

title: Coconut Chutney
steps: Add coconut, chana dal, chili, salt, and water to blender.
Blend into smooth paste.
Heat oil and add mustard seeds.
Add curry leaves and let splutter.
Pour tempering over chutney.
Mix gently.
Serve fresh with dosa or idli.

title: Vegetable Sandwich
steps: Spread butter on bread slices.
Apply green chutney evenly.
Layer potato, cucumber, and tomato slices.
Sprinkle salt and pepper.
Cover with another slice of bread.
Cut diagonally and serve.

title: Aloo Gobi
steps: Heat oil in a pan on medium heat.
Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add onions and sauté until translucent.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Stir in turmeric, coriander, and salt.
Add potatoes and cauliflower; mix well.
Cover and cook for 15–20 minutes until veggies are tender.
Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with cilantro.
Serve hot with chapati or rice.
memoryNote: Simple home-style cauliflower and potato curry.

title: Pav Bhaji
steps: Heat butter in a pan.
Sauté onions and capsicum until soft.
Add tomato puree and cook for 5 minutes.
Add vegetables, spices, and mash well.
Simmer for 10 minutes until thick.
Toast pav with butter on a pan.
Serve bhaji with buttered pav and lemon.
memoryNote: Popular festive street food served during gatherings.

title: Mango Lassi
steps: Add mango pulp, yogurt, milk, and sugar to a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Add cardamom and ice.
Pour into glasses and serve chilled.
memoryNote: Cooling summer drink during festive lunches.

title: Jeera Aloo
steps: Heat oil and crackle cumin seeds.
Add potatoes and spices.
Toss well and cook until lightly crispy.
Garnish with cilantro and serve.

title: Veg Manchurian
steps: Mix vegetables with flour and spices.
Shape into balls and deep fry.
Prepare sauce and toss fried balls.
Serve hot.

title: Masala Corn
steps: Heat butter and add corn.
Add spices and mix well.
Finish with lemon juice.
Serve warm.

title: Masala Chai
steps: Boil water with spices.
Add tea and milk.
Simmer and strain.
Serve hot.

title: Vegetable Spring Rolls
steps: Stir-fry vegetables.
Fill wrappers and roll.
Deep fry until golden.
Serve hot.

title: Lemon Mint Mocktail
steps: Muddle mint with lemon and sugar.
Add ice and soda.
Stir and serve chilled.

title: Mixed Veg Upma
steps: Roast semolina lightly.
Temper mustard seeds and sauté veggies.
Add water and bring to boil.
Add semolina slowly and cook.
Garnish and serve hot.
